how quickly this caught on and how quickly it became ubiquitous at home to say Alexa turn on the lights it just
became really easy to do that with a simple interface that was really conversational and people are really
comfortable doing that because it's a natural way of interacting it was it was really amazing
after Alexa was announced and in the home how quickly developers started building alexis skills or voice

like Arizona State University Georgia Tech Arizona State is a great example
so they started actually putting echo devices in their engineering dorm room took her house and students were

Engineering students to start actually building Alexis skills or voice applications they're really helping

our AWS enterprise customers were coming to us with really cool things that they were wanting to do in the enterprise
with Alexa and echo devices but there was a problem if you have an echo device
at home you've sat and use the Alexa companion app and set up that device it's pretty easy if you're doing one at
a time if you're setting up 50 devices or a hundred or even a thousand devices
that becomes really time intensive and it's a really heavy lift so our customers asked us for a simple way that
they could deploy manage echo devices as well as skills and so we actually built
this Alexa management console called Alexa for business that console lives
within the AWS console and it's a simple and user-friendly way that you can build Alexa skills for your enterprise and
then manage that experience all within the console so one of the other things
that Enterprise customers were asking us for is the ability to build a skill that they would only expose to their
organization so we had financial customers coming to us that what they wanted to do really interesting things
with an Alexis skill but it may touch the most sensitive pieces of data that they have and these really sensitive
workflows so they wanted to way to build a skill and only expose that to their organization so that's another benefit
of Alexa for business you can build an Alexis skill called a private skill and just keep that exposed only internally
to your end users or your students so rather than having to publish a skill to the public skill store you could build
multiple private skills internally at your organization and actually manage that experience with devices the other
interesting thing that Alexa for business allows customers to do is assign a location to a device so you can
assign a room profile to a device and actually give that device certain characteristics based on where it is so
you can think about a device in a conference room or a lobby and they may have different characteristics that you'd
want to associate based on where that is and then a different skill that you'd want that device to be able to invoke
when someone walks up to it so all of that's possible with Alexa for business in addition to our customers we
launched this product in in November 2017 with customers like we work and Brooks Brothers in addition to them sort
of coming to us with these really cool use cases we also saw a lot of partners building really interesting solutions in
